dcterms:creator: T. J. Pollard
A. E. Johnson
dcterms:description: The MIMIC-III clinical database is a large, freely accessible database that contains health-related information associated with distinct hospital admissions, including clinical notes and ICD codes.
dcterms:title: MIMIC-III

dcterms:description: The Diagnosis_ICD dataset consists of unique hospital admission IDs (HADM_IDs) with associated ICD codes, used for labeling and categorizing clinical data.
dcterms:title: Diagnosis_ICD (part of MIMIC-III)

dcterms:description: The Noteevents dataset consists of medical texts belonging to various categories, including discharge summaries, used for training models in clinical text processing.
dcterms:title: Noteevents (part of MIMIC-III)

dcterms:description: Chapter-IV ICD Codes (280-289) refers to a specific subset of ICD codes related to diseases of the blood and blood-forming organs, used for categorization in the study.
dcterms:title: Chapter-IV ICD Codes (280-289)

dcterms:description: Short-summaries are derived from the MIMIC-III dataset, created by processing full-length discharge summaries to remove unnecessary information and focus on relevant clinical data.
dcterms:title: Short-summaries (derived from MIMIC-III)
